meanings.definition: The act of making something firm or solid.
meanings.sent1: The firming of the clay was essential for the sculpture to hold its shape.
meanings.sent2: She applied the firming pressure to the edges of the puzzle to keep it together.
meanings.sent3: The firming of the jello made it bounce like a rubber ball!
meanings.sent4: The firming of the handshake symbolized their agreement.
meanings.sent5: The firming of the ground beneath their feet gave them confidence to walk forward.

meanings.definition: The process of becoming more secure or stable.
meanings.sent1: The firming of their friendship brought them closer together.
meanings.sent2: The firming of the foundation ensured the building's stability.
meanings.sent3: The firming of the chair made it the most sought-after seat in the room.
meanings.sent4: The firming of his resolve made him unstoppable in achieving his goals.
meanings.sent5: The firming of the bond between them made them inseparable.

meanings.definition: The action of strengthening or tightening.
meanings.sent1: The firming of her grip on the rope helped her climb the mountain.
meanings.sent2: The firming of the muscles in his arms showed his dedication to fitness.
meanings.sent3: The firming of the lid on the jar made it impossible to open.
meanings.sent4: The firming of the rules in the household brought order to chaos.
meanings.sent5: The firming of his belief in himself propelled him to success.
